kickstart.inventory

Class InventoryController

  • java.lang.Object
    • kickstart.inventory.InventoryController

  • @Controller
public class InventoryController
extends java.lang.Object
    This controller is responsible for all interactions to the inventory. For example this includes showing the current amounts or reordering. Note that all methods always return a String, which is the name of the shown html file. Therefore this isn't specified further in the individual javadoc. Also are all methods only accessable for users with the role employee

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  InventoryController.TableElement
      This inner class is used to easier combine information from Articles and InventoryItems

      • inventoryView

        @GetMapping(value="/inventory")
 @PreAuthorize(value="hasRole(\'ROLE_EMPLOYEE\')")
public java.lang.String inventoryView(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        This method shows a web site where for each item the name and current amount in the inventory is shown

        model - Stores the information for the view

      • showReorder

        @GetMapping(value="reorder/{identifier}")
 @PreAuthorize(value="hasRole(\'ROLE_EMPLOYEE\')")
public java.lang.String showReorder(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                                 org.salespointframework.catalog.ProductIdentifier identifier,
                                                                                                                                 ReorderForm form,
                                                                                                                                 org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        This method shows a website where the desired amount for that reorder can be entered. If the identifier is unknown, then an error page is shown instead.
        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier of the desired article.
        form - The form stores the amount that should be ordered and verifies the input.
        model - Stores the information for the view
        Returns:

      • reorder

        @PostMapping(value="reorder/{identifier}")
 @PreAuthorize(value="hasRole(\'ROLE_EMPLOYEE\')")
public java.lang.String reorder(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                              org.salespointframework.catalog.ProductIdentifier identifier,
                                                                                                                              @Valid @ModelAttribute(value="form")
                                                                                                                              @Valid ReorderForm form,
                                                                                                                              org.springframework.validation.BindingResult bindingResult,
                                                                                                                              org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                                                                                              org.springframework.validation.Errors result)
        This method adds an reorder for the article. If the form contains error, it leads instead back to the input side
        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier for the desired article, so that the ReorderableInventoryItem can be found
        form - Contains the user input
        bindingResult - Needed for validation
        model - Stores the information for the view
        result - Needed for validation
        Returns:
